assessment.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic learningInteractionBase-d) (topic learningInteractionBase-d learning-d) (topic learningmeta-d) (topic learningBase+learningInteractionBase-d) (topic learningBase+learningInteractionBase-d learningAssessment)

question.questionContent: The modern word plumber is derived from the Latin word for _____.

answerOption.answer: the water channels that supplied Rome
a person who works with lead

question.questionContent: LEED applies to all areas of the plumbing profession, except _____.
Water that comes from laundry and bathtubs and reused is known as _____.
Suggested national plumbing standards are called _____.
You are offered a job by another contractor before you have fulfilled your current obligations. The professional response is to _____.

answerOption.answer: ask the contractor to wait until you have met your obligations
notify your current employer of your intention to leave immediately
ask your current employer to let you divide your time between both projects
determine if your current employer is willing to negotiate better terms

question.questionContent: Your supervisor points out that you forgot to complete a step in the assembly of a drain in a DWV system. One of the apprentices that you are supervising was the person installing the drain. The responsible action is to _____.

answerOption.answer: explain that one of the apprentices was responsible
ask the apprentice to explain to your supervisor
explain to your supervisor why the apprentice did the work that way
take responsibility for work done under your supervision

question.questionContent: People who develop, design, manufacture, and test mechanical devices are called _____.

answerOption.answer: assessing the materials and labor needed on projects
ensuring that projects are in compliance with safety regulations
controlling the scope and direction of a plumbing business
instructing all new apprentices on a job site

question.questionContent: The minimum standards for training programs in the United States are set by _____.
Participants in an NCCER training program receive all of the following, except _____.

answerOption.answer: a listing in the National Registry
certificates for each completed training level

question.questionContent: The non-profit _____ developed a system in 2000 that will certify a building as “green,” meaning it is energy efficient.

answerOption.answer: United States Energy and Environmental Design Association

question.questionContent: Which of the following does NOT cause backflow?

answerOption.answer: Injection of air into the system

question.questionContent: A student must complete ____ hours of OJL per year, according to the Office of Apprenticeship.
_____ is the highest level of skill a craftsman can become in their craft profession.
